com.tabuto.j2dgf
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      com.tabuto.j2dgf.Sprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Seed, Zlife
public abstract class Sprite
extends java.util.Observable
implements Drawable, java.io.Serializable

Sprite is an Abstract Class that represents an object able draws himself and move on a playfield of fixed dimension.

It has got an ACTIVE flag and a ThisIsMe(Graphics) method called by drawMe(Graphics) method when ACTIVE is true;
Every Sprite has a position defined by two variables (xc and yc) that identifies the sprite's center; Every sprite also has speed and angle variable.
To instance a new Sprite you have to call the constructor method Sprite(Dimension,double, double) to set the dimension plane where sprite live and his start position.
Every sprite can be part of Group

Version:
0.7.0
Author:
tabuto83
See Also:
Group, Point, Vettore, Game2D, Serialized Form

d

protected java.awt.Dimension d
The Dimension of the playfield where sprites live is. Example:
 Dimension playfield = new Dimension(1024,768);
 playfiled.width return width (1024);
 playfield.height return heigth (768);
